sen.j: 藤原 武智麻呂（ふじわら の むちまろ、天武天皇9年（680年） - 天平9年7月25日 (旧暦)（737年8月29日））は、飛鳥時代から奈良時代前期にかけての貴族・政治家。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro (AD 680 to August 29, AD 737) was an aristocrat and a politician from Asuka period to the early Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Muchimaro (680 - August 29, 737) was a noble and a politician from Asuka period to the early Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Muchimaro (680 - August 29, 737) was a noble and a politician from Asuka period to the early Nara period.

sen.j: 藤原不比等の長男で、藤原四兄弟の一人。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, that is, he was one of Fujiwara four brothers.
He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and one of Fujiwara four brothers.
sen.cmt: 文法に問題がありました。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and one of Fujiwara four brothers.
He was the originator of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was the originator of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was the originator of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
In AD 718, he was Shikibukyo (Highness of Ceremonial).
In 718, he became Shikibukyo (Highness of Ceremonial).
sen.cmt: 文法に問題がありました。
sen.e: In 718, he became Shikibukyo (Highness of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 父没後の同5年（721年）には、中納言に昇進して藤原一族の中心的存在となる。
sen.e: After his father's death, in AD 721, he was promoted to Middle Councillor and became Fujiwara clan's central person.
After his father's death, he was promoted to Middle Councillor and became Fujiwara clan's central person in 721.

sen.j: 長屋王失脚後の神亀元年（729年）に大納言、天平6年（734年）に右大臣就任。
sen.e: After Prince Nagaya lost power, in AD 729, he became chief councilor of state, and in AD 734, he was appointed the position the Minister of the Right.
After Prince Nagaya lost his power, he became chief councilor of state in 729 and was appointed the position the Minister of the Right in 734.
sen.cmt: 文法に問題がありました。
sen.e: After Prince Nagaya lost his power, he became chief councilor of state in 729 and was appointed the position the Minister of the Right in 734.

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）7月、当時流行していた天然痘に倒れ、臨終の床にて正一位左大臣を授けられる。
sen.e: In 737 July, he fell in the smallpox that was prevalent around at that time, and was awarded Senior First Rank Minister of the Left in his dying bed.
In 737 July, he came down with smallpox that was prevalent at that time and was awarded Senior First Rank Minister of the Left in his dying bed.
sen.cmt: fell in をcame downに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 737 July, he came down with smallpox that was prevalent at that time and was awarded Senior First Rank Minister of the Left in his dying bed.

sen.j: 弟の藤原房前に比べると政治的活動は乏しいと言われている。
sen.e: Compared with his younger brother FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, he was said to be inactive in politics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In contrast to his younger brother FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, he was said to be inactive in politics.
sen.cmt: 文法に問題がありました。

sen.j: しかし、大学頭だった時代に大学制度の設立につくすなど文教行政面での活躍は特筆すべきものがある。
sen.e: However, something that deserves a special mention is, while he was the university head, he was active in the educational administration side such as the establishment of the university system.

sen.j: 彼自身も深い教養の持ち主であり、聖武天皇の皇太子時代には家庭教師役（東宮傅）に選ばれたこともあった。
sen.e: Being a refined cultured educated person himself, he was selected as the home tutor (Togu-no-fu) in Emperor Shomu's Crown Prince period.
Because he was a well educated person himself, he was selected as the home tutor (Togu-no-fu) for Emperor Shomu when he was a Crown Princess.

sen.j: 死後、天平宝字4年（760年）には太政大臣を追贈された。
sen.e: After his death, in AD 760, he was awarded the Grand Minister of State.

sen.j: 奈良県五條市の栄山寺裏山に墓所がある。
sen.e: His grave yard was in the the back hill of Eizan-ji Temple, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture.
